title: NAV reporting tab
body: The NAV reporting tab features options for setting up custom NAV reports and sending NAV reports by email.

title: NAV reporting tab
body: NAV report PDF template

title: NAV reporting tab
body: The path to the PDF template used for building NAV reports. The path to the default template is pre-filled for you. To use a custom template, enter the template path in the field. To learn more about configuring custom reports, see Customize the NAV report (XLSX) in FA Developer guide.

title: NAV reporting tab
body: NAV report XLSX template

title: NAV reporting tab
body: The path to the XSLX template used for building NAV reports. The path to the default template is pre-filled for you. To use a custom template, enter the template path in the field. To learn more about configuring custom reports, see Customize the NAV report (XLSX) in FA Developer guide.

title: NAV reporting tab
body: Send report via email

title: NAV reporting tab
body: Enable sending NAV reports by email. You can send NAV reports by email from FA Back (for instructions, see Send documents via email). We recommend that your administrator schedules the report sending in Tools → Administer → Scheduled functions in FA Back. For example, you can have the emails sent out every afternoon on the days when you calculate NAV.

title: NAV reporting tab
body: Recipients

title: NAV reporting tab
body: Emails to send the reports to. Email addresses in this field are automatically added to the "Report via email" list of emails in FA Back, meaning that all other reports that are generated for the fund are sent to this email too.

title: Swing pricing tab
body: The Swing pricing tab lets you define settings for swing pricing. Click Apply swing pricing and fill in the fields.

title: Swing pricing tab
body: Official NAV

title: Swing pricing tab
body: A setting to choose how swing adjustment is used in your fund. Choose one of the options:

title: Swing pricing tab
body: Swung NAV - Swing adjustment is included in official NAV. The logic of handling swing adjustment is shown in the table.

title: Swing pricing tab
body: Unswung NAV – Swing adjustment is not included in official NAV. The logic of handling swing adjustment is shown in the table.

title: Swing factor
body: Swing factor is used for adjusting the unit price.

title: Swing factor
body: For swinging up

title: Swing factor
body: The percentage to adjust the unit price if the net inflow of the fund exceeds the threshold.

title: Swing factor
body: For swinging down

title: Swing factor
body: The percentage to adjust the unit price if the net outflow of the fund exceeds the threshold.

title: Thresholds
body: Swing thresholds are the net inflow or net outflow of the fund that triggers the adjustment to the NAV. You can set a threshold in fund currency or as a percentage of the fund's total net asset value on the NAV date.

title: Thresholds
body: For swinging up

title: Thresholds
body: Net inflow that triggers swinging up.

title: Thresholds
body: For swinging down

title: Thresholds
body: Net outflow that triggers swinging down.

title: Income distribution tab
body: The Income distribution tab features settings for keeping track of the fund's accrued income and calculating the tax on it if needed. FA Fund Management app calculates the accrued income based on the bookkeeping postings and records the result into your fund every time you calculate NAV. You can choose to calculate tax on the accrued income at the same time.

title: Income distribution tab
body: After NAV is calculated, the system creates transactions for accrued income and calculated tax. The calculation also allocates accrued income per share class in security market data (Security window, Market data tab in FA Back) while pricing the share classes with NAV.

title: Income distribution tab
body: Click Enable income distribution and fill in the fields.

title: Accrued income
body: Settings to calculate accrued income.

title: Accrued income
body: Accrued income formula

title: Accrued income
body: Fee formula to calculate accrued income. Accrued income is calculated every time you calculate NAV.

title: Accrued income
body: Fee formula can be specified either for the whole fund or for a share class (not for both). Make sure that you don’t have any fee formulas in the Share class wizard, Fee structure tab if you use fund-level rules and the other way round.

title: Accrued income
body: Transaction type

title: Accrued income
body: Type of the transaction generated by the accrued income formula.

title: Accrued income
body: Bookkeeping accounts used to calculate income distributions

title: Accrued income
body: Fields for bookkeeping accounts to track accrued income. When you calculate NAV, FA sums up the balances on the specified bookkeeping accounts on the NAV date. To enter multiple account numbers, separate them with a semicolon. To include only part of the account balance in the calculation, enter a percentage after the account number. For example, "123456=45,5" means that 45,5% of the 123456 account balance is used in the calculation.

title: Accrued income
body: Mark all “Ready” bookkeeping postings from start of the year to the NAV date as “Reported” when NAV is accepted

title: Accrued income
body: Change the status of bookkeeping postings produced by income distribution when the NAV is accepted. In most cases, you need to have this option selected.

title: Accrued tax
body: Settings to calculate tax on accrued income.

title: Accrued tax
body: Calculate tax of the accrued income distribution

title: Accrued tax
body: Option to record tax to be paid on the accrued income. Fill in the tax parameters below.

title: Accrued tax
body: Tax formula

title: Accrued tax
body: Fee formula used to calculate tax on accrued income.

title: Accrued tax
body: Transaction type

title: Accrued tax
body: Type of the transaction generated by the tax formula.

title: Accrued tax
body: Tax percentage

title: Accrued tax
body: Percentage of accrued income to be paid as tax.

title: Accounting tab
body: The Accounting tab lets you define accounts and rules for generating postings for income distribution (for other income distribution settings, see Income distribution tab .

title: Accounting tab
body: Automated deferral runs before NAV calculation

title: Accounting tab
body: Settings for deferral runs before NAV calculation. You need to run deferrals to generate postings for the income distribution calculation.

title: Accounting tab
body: Choose the deferral type to run and the previous deferral date. If the previous deferral date is empty, the starting date of the fund is used.

title: Accounting tab
body: Accounting rules for income distribution-related postings

title: Accounting tab
body: Accounting rules that are used to generate postings related to income distribution. These rules are specified in the system configuration made by FA consultants. Enter them in the Accounting rules for income distribution-related postings field to change posting status to “Reported” when you accept NAV.

title: Advanced settings tab
body: The Advanced settings tab contains miscellaneous settings for your fund.

title: Unit certificates
body: Setting for unit certificates. To learn more about unit certificates in the FA Fund management app, see the Unit certificate

title: Unit certificates
body: Report template (PDF)

title: Unit certificates
body: The path to the custom Unit certificate template. For example, "/UnitCertificateCustom/Unit certificate".

title: Unit certificates
body: Transaction types

title: Unit certificates
body: Transaction types for the unit certificate to show in the Shareholder registry view. If empty, only the UC type is shown.

title: Pricing of share class without shareholders
body: Define how the unit price for newly created share classes with no shareholders is set:

title: Pricing of share class without shareholders
body: Select the checkbox to use the previous price of the share class.

title: Pricing of share class without shareholders
body: Leave the checkbox empty to use the price from the share class with a higher priority.

title: Allocation
body: Define the setting for updating the share class security allocations.

title: Allocation
body: Update fund security allocations automatically when accepting NAV

title: Allocation
body: The option to update allocations for the share class securities when you accept NAV. You can view allocations in the Security window, Allocations tab in FA Back.

title: Allocation
body: Update allocations for securities that get price from share classes

title: Allocation
body: The option to update allocations for securities that get prices from share classes. For example, such structure with multiple securities can be used, if your fund shares are sold via a nominee. In this case, the share class ownership is handled with two securities:

title: Allocation
body: Share class security that is automatically created in FA Back when you add a share class. This security has the nominee as a shareholder.

title: Allocation
body: Security that has the same prices as the share class security and is owned by end clients. This security is used to get share class positions in clients' portfolios. To link this security to the share class security, open it in FA Back and choose the share class security in the Price from security field.

title: Allocation
body: Choose Update allocations for all securities that get price from share classes to have allocations updated for all securities.

title: Allocation
body: Allocation groups

title: Allocation
body: Allocation groups to update share class allocations based on fund portfolio contents when you accept NAV. Allocations are updated for the configured group(s), based on the fund portfolio’s allocations on the NAV date.

title: Share class wizard
body: The Share class wizard lets you create, edit or delete a fund share class. When you create a share class in the Fund management app, FA creates a share class security with the specified properties in FA Back.

title: Share class wizard
body: To add a share class, click the button in the Fund details pane.

title: Share class wizard
body: To edit a share class, click the button in the Share class details pane.

title: Share class wizard
body: To delete a share class click Delete in the Share class wizard. You can delete a share class only if it doesn't have any transactions and isn't used in benchmarks.

title: Basic info tab
body: Share class details and NAV calculation settings.

title: Basic info tab
body: Code*

title: Basic info tab
body: A unique code defined for the share class. The code is used to identify the share class security and search for securities in the system. We recommend using numbers and letters (a-z) and avoiding special characters in the security code.

title: Basic info tab
body: ISIN

title: Basic info tab
body: The ISIN code of the share class security.

title: Basic info tab
body: Name*

title: Basic info tab
body: Name of the share class security.

title: Basic info tab
body: Type*

title: Basic info tab
body: Share class security type. Choose the type that is configured for funds in Preferences. If you have standard solution configuration, use Collective investment vehicles type.

title: Basic info tab
body: Holiday calendar*

title: Basic info tab
body: A holiday calendar that determines business days and holidays in the market to set a settlement date for subscriptions and redemptions. Holiday calendar options are configured in Preferences. You can also set the default holiday calendar used for new securities in Preferences.

title: Basic info tab
body: Share class priority

title: Basic info tab
body: The order in which share class NAVs are calculated if there are multiple share classes. The NAV for the share class with the highest priority is calculated first.

title: Basic info tab
body: Decimal count for transaction units

title: Basic info tab
body: Number of decimals used in the units field of the client transactions. If the field is empty, the number of decimals set for the security type is used.

title: Pricing tab
body: Unit price settings:

title: Pricing tab
body: Currency

title: Pricing tab
body: Share class currency – the currency share class units are quoted in.

title: Pricing tab
body: Initial price

title: Pricing tab
body: (Set for a new share class). Initial price of the share class unit. Initial unit price is used for the first NAV calculation. The price you enter is copied to the Market data info tab in the Security window in FA Back.

title: Pricing tab
body: Date of initial price

title: Pricing tab
body: (Set when you create a share class). The date for which the initial unit price is valid.

title: Pricing tab
body: Format

title: Pricing tab
body: Unit price multipliers to use in calculations. For more information about multipliers, see the description of the Basic info tab in the Security window. Choose one of the options:

title: Pricing tab
body: Show price as is – Show the share class unit price without any multipliers.

title: Pricing tab
body: In percentage – Use "100" in both Multiplier fields for the security.

title: Pricing tab
body: Add manually – Enter the multipliers in the fields below.

title: Pricing tab
body: Decimals for share class NAV

title: Pricing tab
body: The number of decimals used in the share class NAV. If the field is empty, NAV is stored with 10 decimals.

title: Pricing tab
body: Dividend payments

title: Pricing tab
body: Enable dividend payments for the share class. You can calculate and execute dividends in the Dividends view. For details, see Dividends view.

title: Fee structure tab
body: The Fee structure tab defines costs and fees applied on the share class level. Share class-level fees are calculated after the fund level fees, in the order you put them in the Share class wizard. Click Add fee and enter the information about the share class fees:

title: Fund fees
body: Fund fees

title: Fund fees
body: Fee formula

title: Fund fees
body: Fee formula used to calculate the fee and generate fee transaction.

title: Fund fees
body: Fee transaction type

title: Fund fees
body: Transaction type linked to the chosen fee formula.

title: Fund fees
body: Amount or %

title: Fund fees
body: Fee percentage or amount in the fund currency, depending on the fee formula.

title: Fund fees
body: Decimals

title: Fund fees
body: The number of decimals used for calculating fees (0 to 10). The “Default” value is 2 decimals.

title: Fund fees
body: Ex-post cost category

title: Fund fees
body: Ex-post cost category for the fee. The categorization is used in cost analysis and reporting (see View ex-post costs and charges in FA User guide), as well as for creating kickbacks (see Rebate contracts (kickbacks) in FA User guide).

title: Fund fees
body: Account currency

title: Fund fees
body: The currency of the share class fee accrual account. Choose if the fees should be accrued in the fund currency or in the share class currency. The field is shown only if the share class currency is different from the fund currency.

title: Fund fees
body: Additional options

title: Fund fees
body: Additional fee setups.

title: Fund fees
body: Formula sets its own account

title: Fund fees
body: Set an account for the fee formula. For example, this can be useful with accrued account interest transactions over multiple accounts.

title: Fund fees
body: Include in income distribution

title: Fund fees
body: Include the fee in the income distribution calculation.

title: Fund fees
body: Use crystallization schedule for capitalization

title: Fund fees
body: Capitalize fees automatically on the crystallization date when you accept NAV. The crystallization dates are defined in the Fund wizard, Schedules tab. Fees are capitalized to the account that has “Fee capitalization” tag. If no account is marked with this tag, fees are capitalized to the default cash account.

title: Transaction fees
body: The Transaction fees section contains parameters for subscription and redemption fees and charging them automatically when you calculate NAV. Enter the subscription and redemption fee parameters:

title: Transaction fees
body: Calculate fee for net trade amount-based subscriptions

title: Transaction fees
body: The amount from which the subscription fee is calculated in net trade amount-based trade orders: order trade amount or the sum invested in the fund.

title: Transaction fees
body: Define default transaction fees

title: Transaction fees
body: Settings for subscription and redemption fees calculated automatically and included in the transaction:

title: Transaction fees
body: Cost percentage

title: Transaction fees
body: Fee percentage to calculate the fee amount.

title: Transaction fees
body: To set the fee as a fixed amount per transaction, enter "0" as a cost percentage and then specify the fee amount in the Minimum field.

title: Transaction fees
body: Minimum

title: Transaction fees
body: The minimum fee amount to charge.

title: Transaction fees
body: Currency

title: Transaction fees
body: Fee currency automatically set to the share class currency.

title: Performance fee equalization
body: The Performance fee equalization section contains parameters to calculate and equalize performance fee. In addition to choosing the fee parameters here, you need to define the crystallization schedule in the Fund wizard, Schedules tab, and the fee formula in the Fund wizard, Fee structure tab.

title: Performance fee equalization
body: Fee percentage

title: Performance fee equalization
body: Fee percentage to calculate the fee amount.

title: Performance fee equalization
body: Hurdle rate

title: Performance fee equalization
body: The minimum NAV increase above HWM starting from which the performance fee is paid.

title: Performance fee equalization
body: Day count

title: Performance fee equalization
body: Day count convention to use in performance fee calculation with hurdle rate. If the calculation period is less than a year, the hurdle rate is adjusted proportionally using the day count convention you chose.

title: Performance fee equalization
body: High-water mark

title: Performance fee equalization
body: The initial high water mark (HWM) to use for the performance fee calculation. Usually, HWM is set to the highest NAV value in the share class. On the crystallization date, FA Fund Management compares the share class NAV to the HWM. If NAV is higher than HWM, the HWM value is updated to the current NAV value.

title: Performance fee equalization
body: High-water mark date

title: Performance fee equalization
body: The date on which high-water mark is set.

title: Cash transactions tab
body: Account settings to handle deposits and withdrawals.

title: Cash transactions tab
body: Account number

title: Cash transactions tab
body: A fund portfolio account to record deposits and withdrawals to. If the field is empty, the account in the fund settings or the default account is used.

title: Tax reporting tab
body: Settings for the Finnish tax reporting: fund company business ID and fund business ID.

title: FX hedging tab
body: FX hedging settings to apply if your share class currency is different from the fund currency and you want to use FX hedging to neutralize the effect of the exchange rate. Click Enable FX hedging and fill in the fields. For full instruction on how to set up and manage FX-hedged share classes, see Hedge currency exposure in FA User guide.

title: FX hedging tab
body: Formula

title: FX hedging tab
body: The formula for the FX hedge accrual. You can choose the "FX hedge formula" that comes pre-configured in Standard solution.

title: FX hedging tab
body: FX hedge transaction type

title: FX hedging tab
body: Transaction type linked to the FX hedging formula.

title: FX hedging tab
body: Hedge parent portfolio

title: FX hedging tab
body: ID and portfolio type of the hedge parent portfolio that links fund and hedge portfolios in FA Back. The hedge parent portfolio is empty. It is used to group the fund and hedge portfolios and share accounts between them. You can edit the hedge parent portfolio properties only when you enable hedging for one of the fund share classes for the first time. After that, hedge parent portfolio is set and can't be edited.

title: FX hedging tab
body: Hedge portfolio

title: FX hedging tab
body: ID and portfolio type of the hedge portfolio that contains FX contracts in FA Back. You can edit the hedge portfolio properties only when you enable hedging for a share class. After that, the hedge portfolio is set and can't be edited.

title: Add warnings for NAV calculation
body: Add warnings for NAV calculation

title: Overview
body: The default decision table contains the following checks that can be customized:

title: Overview
body: Negative positions or cash accounts (portfolio)

title: Overview
body: Market price older than calculation date (portfolio)

title: Overview
body: Price has changed more than 5 % for stocks (portfolio)

title: Overview
body: Price has changed more than 1 % for other securities and currencies (portfolio)

title: Overview
body: Negative cash account balance (portfolio)

title: Overview
body: Fund performance vs. benchmark differs by more than 1 % (share class)

title: Overview
body: Exchange rate has changed more than 5 % (portfolio)

title: Getting started
body: You can find the default rules attached below. You should upload the XLSX file to the document bank folder /FundRules

title: Getting started
body: After uploading the rules, go to the GraphiQL for API view and run the following:

title: Getting started
body: mutation updateRules{ reloadFundRules }

title: Getting started
body: fa-decisiontable-fundrules.xlsx

title: How to customize warnings
body: You can edit or add to these rules:

title: How to customize warnings
body: Open the XLSX file and make your modifications

title: How to customize warnings
body: Upload the file to the document bank (FundRules folder)

title: How to customize warnings
body: After uploading the rules, go to the GraphiQL for API view and run the following:

title: How to customize warnings
body: mutation updateRules{ reloadFundRules }

title: Warnings tab
body: When you calculate NAV, FA Fund Management checks the underlying data and shows you warnings if there is anything to double-check.

title: NAV warnings
body: NAV warnings mean that there is something wrong with the fund or NAV calculation settings, so NAV calculation failed. The reasons can be:

title: NAV warnings
body: Missing accrued fee account.

title: NAV warnings
body: Missing accrued fee account balance (normal when there are no earlier fees of the type).

title: NAV warnings
body: Cost formula is invalid and doesn't return any transactions.

title: Share class and Portfolio warnings
body: Share class and Portfolio warnings are based on the decision table rules that check share classes and portfolios. To learn more about decision tables, see Business rules.

title: Share class and Portfolio warnings
body: The default decision table contains the following checks that you can adjust:

title: Share class and Portfolio warnings
body: Negative positions or cash account balance (portfolio)

title: Share class and Portfolio warnings
body: Market price older than calculation date (portfolio)

title: Share class and Portfolio warnings
body: Price has changed more than 5% for stocks (portfolio)

title: Share class and Portfolio warnings
body: Price has changed more than 1% for other securities and currencies (portfolio)

title: Share class and Portfolio warnings
body: Fund performance vs. benchmark differs by more than 1% (share class)

title: Share class and Portfolio warnings
body: The difference in the outstanding units in the current and previous NAV calculation does not match the number of units from the executed transactions (share class)

title: Share class and Portfolio warnings
body: Exchange rate has changed more than 5 % (portfolio)

title: Limit warnings
body: Limit warnings mean that the fund portfolio positions are close to or outside the warning or breach thresholds set for the portfolio.

title: Limit warnings
body: Warning: portfolio values are beyond the warning threshold.

title: Limit warnings
body: Breached: portfolio values are outside the breach threshold.

title: Limit warnings
body: To learn more about setting investment limits in FA Back, see Portfolio limits.

title: Shareholder registry view
body: Shareholder registry view shows the fund’s shareholders and their ownership in the fund as a tree structure. Expand the shareholder name to view share classes to which the shareholder has ownership. Expand a share class to view the purchase lots in this share class.

title: Fund selection
body: The Select a fund dropdown at the top lets you choose a fund to view shareholders for. This dropdown shows the funds included in groups with a code starting with “FAFUND”. Learn more about setting up fund groups in FA User Guide.

title: Registry date
body: Choose the date in the Registry date field to view the fund shareholders for a specific date.

title: Load purchase lots
body: To see the purchase lots for each shareholder in the list, check the Load purchase lots box. This shows the whole history of purchase lots, including the ones not held anymore. By default, this option is disabled.

title: Table columns
body: Contact ID

title: Table columns
body: The customer’s contact ID stored in FA Back. This is a unique ID of the shareholder, such as a social security number.

title: Table columns
body: Shareholder

title: Table columns
body: The top level shows name of the shareholder. Lower levels show share classes the shareholder owns and date of the open purchase lots within each share class (the individual purchases the shareholder made into the share class). Purchase lots under each share class are ordered from oldest to newest according to FIFO (based on purchase lot date or the order they appear in during the same date).

title: Table columns
body: Address (Address 1, Address 2, Postal code, City, Country)

title: Table columns
body: The details stored in the Address info tab of the contact in FA Back. If the customer information contains multiple addresses, the shareholder registry shows the first address defined in the contact in FA Back.

title: Table columns
body: Tax country

title: Table columns
body: Classifications stored under "tax country" in the contact in FA Back. The tax country often indicates where the shareholder pays taxes. In the FA Platform, this is also used to calculate taxes.

title: Table columns
body: Share class

title: Table columns
body: The name of the share class.

title: Table columns
body: Total ownership

title: Table columns
body: Shown on the shareholder level. The shareholder’s ownership in the fund as a percentage of as a percentage of the net asset value of the fund:

This pane lets you create, download and delete unit certificates. To learn more about this document, see the Unit certificate section.

title: Shareholder details
body: To generate a unit certificate, click the icon, enter the number of units and click Create. To download a previously generated unit certificate, click the PDF icon . To delete a unit certificate after it is returned, click . To learn more, see the Generating and deleting the unit certificate section.

title: Process monitoring view
body: Process monitoring view

The Process monitoring view provides visibility into processes that take place in FA. It allows you to see which processes were run, how long they took, and whether or not they were completed successfully. If a process is ongoing, you can see details about its progress and evaluate how long it may take. The view also provides input for monitoring the performance of processes over time.

The system monitors processes such as user-triggered and scheduled processes, authority and client reporting, and custom processes. For example, for nightly price updates and report calculation, the monitoring tracks the process through the following stages:
Start
Fetch active portfolios
Handle market data connector 1 (if enabled)
Find applicable securities
Fetch and save close prices
Update cashflow securities
Handle market data connector 2 (if enabled)
Handle market data connector 3 (if enabled)
Update discount factors (if no connectors 1-3 defined)
Schedule report updates
End

title: Tracked processes
body: The initial release of this feature covers the following processes, but the coverage will be expanded in future releases:

title: Tracked processes
body: NAV calculation

title: Tracked processes
body: NAV acceptance

title: Tracked processes
body: NAV rollback

title: Tracked processes
body: Run deferrals

title: Tracked processes
body: NAV rejection

title: Tracked processes
body: NAV acceptance interruption and NAV rollback

title: Tracked processes
body: Corporate actions

title: Tracked processes
body: Nightly price update and report calculation

title: View the process timeline
body: In the Process monitoring view, you can see the timeline of process runs during a given period by choosing the start and end dates. To view information about a specific process, select the application it relates to. You can filter the list down by selecting a single process type, instance, or status. You can also adjust the time scale of the process timeline by using the slider on the right.

title: View the process timeline
body: The color of the blocks indicates the completion status of a run, with blue meaning ongoing, green meaning completed, and red meaning failed. Click on the process to view its information: start and end times of a run, its completion status, duration, and the user who executed it. You can expand the process run to see the stages.

title: View process details
body: To view the details of a process run or stage, click in the Actions column. The details shown depend on the process. For example, for the NAV acceptance process, you can see the date on which the NAV was accepted. If the run failed, you can view the error message. If the process was canceled, the details show the user who canceled it.

title: Process information
body: The following information is available in the Process monitoring view:

title: Process information
body: Start time

title: Process information
body: The start date and time of the run.

title: Process information
body: End time

title: Process information
body: The end date and time of the run.

title: Process information
body: Status

title: Process information
body: The completion status of the run. The status is completed for a successful run, failed for an unsuccessful run, and ongoing for a run that has not finished.

title: Process information
body: Duration

title: Process information
body: The duration of the run in minutes, seconds, and milliseconds.

title: Process information
body: User

title: Process information
body: The username of the user who executed the run.

title: Process information
body: Actions

title: Process information
body: The Actions column shows the button to open process run or stage details.

title: Holdings view
body: The Holdings view shows the client’s investments and lets the user buy, sell and switch securities. The user can view the list of securities in all portfolios or in a portfolio chosen in the drop-down at the top. If a portfolio has subportfolios, the Holdings view shows values aggregated from subportfolios.

title: Holdings view
body: Holdings in the list are grouped by security type. For each holding in the list, the user can view its ISIN code, number of units, purchase value, total market value and unrealized profit since start.

title: Holdings view
body: The user can download the list of holdings in the XLSX file when viewing the page on a larger screen or desktop.

title: Holding details

title: Holding details
body: Buy and/or Sell buttons. To enable buying and selling, you need to include the portfolio in the CP_TRADING group and add a "Tradeable" tag to the security in FA Back.

title: Holding details

title: Buying and selling securities

title: Buying and selling securities

title: Buying and selling securities

title: Buying and selling securities

title: Buying and selling securities
body: By default, all security types except for collective investment vehicles are traded in units. Collective investment vehicles are traded in trade amount. To change this, go to the Security window in FA Back and choose one or more options in the Trade type field: "Buy units", "Buy trade amount", "Sell units", "Sell trade amount".

title: Buying and selling securities

title: Switching fund positions

title: Switching fund positions

title: Switching fund positions

title: Switching fund positions
body: The approximate trade amount is estimated based on the position share to sell and the latest price.

title: Switching fund positions
body: When the user clicks Confirm , redemption and subscription trade orders are created in FA Back. When the redemption order is executed, the switch order in FA Client Portal is replaced with a buy order. The redemption is shown as a new transaction in the Transactions view.

title: Monthly savings in FA Client Portal
body: The user can set up the monthly savings plan to generate scheduled deposit transactions for portfolios. The user specifies the amount to deposit and defines the schedule, and the FA Platform automatically creates transactions based on the information entered.

title: Monthly savings in FA Client Portal
body: The deposit transactions are generated with a Not finished status and you can manually update them as Accepted if the user has made a manual payment or collect them using direct debit.

title: Monthly savings in FA Client Portal
body: The user can view, edit, and delete their existing savings plans in the FA Client Portal by selecting Monthly savings in the top-right menu.

title: Enable monthly savings in FA Back
body: To enable the monthly savings functionality for the user in FA Client Portal, include the client's portfolios in the CP_MONTHLYSAVINGS portfolio group in FA Back. The user can only set up savings plans for portfolios that are included in the CP_MONTHLYSAVINGS portfolio group.

title: Add a savings plan
body: To add a savings plan in FA Client Portal, the user needs to select Monthly savings in the top-right menu, click on Add new savings plan, and fill in the following information:

title: Add a savings plan
body: Portfolio and amount to save section

title: Add a savings plan
body: In the Portfolio and amount to save section, the user selects a portfolio from the drop-down menu and enters the amount to be saved monthly. The portfolio selection only shows portfolios included in the CP_MONTHLYSAVINGS portfolio group.

title: Add a savings plan
body: You can define a minimum monthly saving amount per portfolio by adding the portfolio key figure CP_MS_MINAMOUNT in FA Back.

title: Add a savings plan
body: When to save section

title: Add a savings plan
body: In the When to save section, the user enters a monthly payment date for the deposit transaction. They can also uncheck the months they do not want to include in the savings plan. The user can also see the resulting amount of savings per year in the portfolio currency, and the value updates according to the number of months selected.

title: Add a savings plan
body: Summary section

title: Add a savings plan
body: The Summary section allows the user to confirm that the information they entered is correct before confirming the savings plan.

title: About FA Developer app
body: FA Developer app gathers services for the third-party developers who work with FA:

title: About FA Developer app
body: GraphQL API — GraphiQL client to query FA over FA GraphQL APIs.

title: About FA Developer app
body: Reports — jsreport designer to develop and test report templates.

title: About FA Developer app
body: Workflows — Flowable modeler to design wor runnable within FA and Form.io designer to create interactive forms that can be embedded in processes in third-party applications.

title: About FA Developer app
body: Integrations — Camel platform to create and manage file-based integrations with other systems.

title: About FA Developer app
body: Notebooks — Jupyter notebooks to manipulate and analyze data from FA and external parties, as well as to store and share your work securely.

title: About FA Developer app
body: Authentication — Keycloak folders to manage and deploy FA custom login themes and other authentication-related customizations.

title: About FA Developer app
body: The access to each of the services is controlled separately with user roles. Depending on your role, you might have access to only some of the services.

title: Workflows view
body: The Workflows view lets you design processes runnable in FA:

title: Workflows view
body: Process modeler gives you access to the Flowable process engine – a visual tool to create business process models and decision tables and package them up for use in the Flowable app. Processes can be accessed through the GraphQL API.

title: Workflows view
body: Process admin view lets you manage processes.

title: Workflows view
body: Forms view gives you access to Form.io designer to create interactive forms that can be embedded in processes in third-party applications

title: Process modeler
body: The Process modeler section lets you create processes. The navigation panel at the top features model editors for different model types. For working with FA, the following options are supported:

title: Process modeler
body: Processes

title: Process modeler
body: Processes editor to create BPMN diagrams. The Business Process Model and Notation (BPMN) specification provides a graphical notation for specifying business processes. To learn more about BPMN, see the BPNM standard description. To learn about how to create processes, see the Processes editor section in the Flowable Design user guide.

title: Process modeler
body: Decisions

title: Process modeler
body: Decisions editor to define a set of business rules in the form of DMN Decision Tables. DMN is a modeling language and notation for the precise specification of business decisions and business rules. To learn more about DMN, see the DMN standard description. To learn about how to create decision tables, see the Decisions editor section in the Flowable Design user guide.

title: Process modeler
body: Apps

title: Process modeler
body: Apps editor to create a bundle of processes that can be deployed and shared with users to run. To learn more about how to create and publish packages, see the App editor section the Flowable Design user guide.

title: Process admin view
body: The Process admin section provides you access to the Flowable Admin app. You can use it to:

title: Process admin view
body: View the deployed and running processes.

title: Process admin view
body: Stop a running process.

title: Process admin view
body: Import and export processes.

title: Process admin view
body: To learn more about the Process admin section, see the Flowable documentation.

title: Forms view
body: The Forms view provides you access to the form.io builder to design forms that you can embed in HTML pages. Forms can be accessed through the GraphQL API.

title: Forms view
body: Forms let you collect information that can be further handled by external apps. For example, an app can display a form for new clients to fill in and save the data in FA or print it out as a PDF. To implement this, the form should be included in a process via the User task element.

title: Forms view
body: To create a form, click Add form at the top-right.

title: Forms view
body: You can export forms and transfer them to other environments. To upload a form, click Import form at the top-right.

title: List of forms

title: List of forms
body: Name

title: List of forms

title: List of forms
body: Form ID

title: List of forms
body: The form ID is used to include a form in a process (specify it as a form key value of the User task element when designing a process).

title: List of forms
body: Actions

title: List of forms
body: The buttons to manage forms:

title: List of forms
body: Edit translations. Use this feature to add and edit form translations, set the default form language, and export translations as XLSX files. In the Edit translations window, you can also preview the form in each language.

title: List of forms
body: Export form in a file that is saved to your computer. Use this feature to copy created forms to another environment.

title: List of forms

title: About FA Advisor
body: FA Advisor app provides advisors with tools for managing customer-related tasks for existing customers and onboarding new customers.

title: About FA Advisor
body: You can use FA Advisor to do the following:

title: About FA Advisor
body: View and edit customer information. You can see a list of all customers and select an individual customer to view their details.

title: About FA Advisor
body: Manage customer-related notes and documents.

title: About FA Advisor
body: View and manage tasks related to a customer. For example, tasks can be reminders to call the customer at a specific time.

title: About FA Advisor
body: Onboard new customers.

title: About FA Advisor
body: View a customer's investments in FA Client Portal with access to the same view as the customer but without the ability to make modifications.

title: Access to FA Advisor
body: Access to FA Advisor

title: Access to Client Portal
body: You can access a view-only version of a customer's FA Client Portal in the Customers view in FA Advisor. To have access, a user needs to have the correct role assigned to them. See User access for detailed instructions.

title: Work with customers
body: In FA Advisor, you can see an overview of all of your customers and select individual customers from the list to see more detailed information about them.

title: Customer information in FA Advisor
body: The following information is available as columns or fields in FA Advisor:

title: Customer information in FA Advisor
body: Customer ID

title: Customer information in FA Advisor
body: A unique ID defined for a customer in FA Back. The customer ID separates a customer from other customers (the system does not allow more than one customer with the same customer ID). Customer ID cannot be edited in FA Advisor. You can edit it in FA Back (Contact ID in Contact window).

title: Customer information in FA Advisor
body: External ID

title: Customer information in FA Advisor
body: The customer’s ID in an external system, for example, identity number or social security number. The external ID can be used to set up client authentication in FA.

title: Customer information in FA Advisor
body: Customer type

title: Customer information in FA Advisor
body: Contact type specified in FA Back. Customer type cannot be edited in FA Advisor. You can edit it in FA Back (Contact window, Type field).

title: Customer information in FA Advisor
body: Name

title: Customer information in FA Advisor
body: The name of the customer.

title: Customer information in FA Advisor
body: Status

title: Customer information in FA Advisor
body: The status of the customer record in the system. Customer status cannot be edited in FA Advisor. You can edit it in FA Back (Contact window).

title: Customer information in FA Advisor
body: Representative

title: Customer information in FA Advisor
body: Advisor or asset manager who represents the customer. Representatives cannot be edited in FA Advisor. You can edit the representatives in FA Back (Representatives tab in Contact window).

title: Customer information in FA Advisor
body: Classification

title: Customer information in FA Advisor
body: The trading classification of the customer, for example, professional or non-professional. Classification cannot be edited in FA Advisor. You can edit it in FA Back (Contact window).

title: Customer information in FA Advisor
body: Juridical form

title: Customer information in FA Advisor
body: The juridical form of the customer, for example, private person or company. Juridical form cannot be edited in FA Advisor. You can edit it in FA Back (Contact window).

title: Customer information in FA Advisor
body: Language

title: Customer information in FA Advisor
body: The language to produce reports for the customer. If no language is selected, the reports are printed out in Finnish. Language cannot be edited in FA Advisor. You can edit it in FA Back (Contact window).

title: Customer information in FA Advisor
body: Nationality

title: Customer information in FA Advisor
body: The nationality of the customer. Nationality cannot be edited in FA Advisor. You can edit it in FA Back (Contact window).

title: Customer information in FA Advisor
body: Taxation country

title: Customer information in FA Advisor
body: The taxation country of the customer. Taxation country cannot be edited in FA Advisor. You can edit it in FA Back (Contact window).

title: Customer information in FA Advisor
body: Tags

title: Customer information in FA Advisor
body: Tags assigned to the customer in the system. Tags are used, for example, to set up access to customer portfolios, manage trade orders, or produce reports. Tags cannot be edited in FA Advisor. You can edit them in FA Back (Contact window).

title: Customer information in FA Advisor
body: Phone numbers 1 and 2

title: Customer information in FA Advisor
body: The customer's phone numbers.

title: Customer information in FA Advisor
body: Email

title: Customer information in FA Advisor
body: The email address of the customer.

title: Customer information in FA Advisor
body: Address (Address 1, Address 2, Postal code, City, Country)

title: Customer information in FA Advisor
body: The customer’s address information.

title: View and edit customer information
body: The Customers view provides an overview of all of your customers as a list. From this view, you can access the details of individual customers as well as open their FA Client Portal profile.

title: View all your customers as a list
body: To see all your customers in a list, open the Customers view. You can search and filter this list and choose to show or hide certain columns, giving you control of the amount of information shown.

title: View all your customers as a list
body: Show or hide columns. Click Columns and toggle the switches next to each column.

title: View all your customers as a list
body: Filter the list. Click Filters and choose the filtering options.

title: View all your customers as a list
body: Save a view with selected filters and columns. Click Save view. You can set the view as the default view if needed. To open a previously saved view, click Select view and choose a view from the dropdown menu. To see all saved views and edit them, click .

title: View all your customers as a list
body: Export the search results.You can print the list of customer information or export it as a CSV file by clicking the Export button.

title: View all your customers as a list
body: SCREENSHOT OF CUSTOMERS VIEW

title: View customer details

title: View customer details

title: View customer details

If the customer has more than 10 portfolios, only 10 are displayed in the pie chart with the smallest portfolios grouped. Portfolios with less than 5% of the total value are also grouped in the pie chart.

title: Access FA Client Portal

title: View and manage documents
body: You can view and manage customer-related documents in the Documents tab of the Notes section. The table shows you the documents that have been uploaded for the customer, grouped by document type using tags (see Preference - Tags to configure document type tags in FA Back).

title: View and manage documents

body: FA Client Portal
