body: The Notes section also allows you to add other tabs for your convenience. To create a new tab, use the + Add tab button and enter a name for it in the Note name field. You can then add your notes in the text editor.

title: FA Operations App
body: FA Operations App

title: About FA Operations
body: FA Operations is an application that helps back-office employees carry out their daily business tasks:

title: About FA Operations
body: Reconciliation – Compare positions and cash accounts from external sources to the data you store in FA.

title: Reconciliation
body: FA Operations lets you reconcile position and cash account data stored in FA with the data you receive from external sources, for example, from your custodian or a bank.

title: Reconciliation
body: Set up data sources. Set up FA Operations to receive reconciliation data from external sources.

title: Reconciliation
body: View reconciliations. View reconciled positions and cash accounts.

title: Reconciliation
body: Assign mismatches for further investigation.

title: Reconciliation
body: Fix a mismatch. You can fix a mismatch in the following ways:

title: Reconciliation
body: Correct the system data so that it matches external data.

title: Reconciliation
body: Have the mismatch corrected by your counterparty.

title: Reconciliation
body: Mark a mismatch as solved in case this is a known issue that you don't need to fix.

title: Reconciliation
body: Close reconciliation with known mismatches if needed.

title: Reconciliation
body: View reconciliation history.

title: Reconciliation
body: Download reconciliation reports for the whole reconciliation or for a chosen item.

title: What is compared
body: FA Operations lets you compare the following data:

title: Receiving external data
body: FA Operations receives external data as a file. Supported file formats are:

title: Receiving external data
body: MT535

title: Receiving external data
body: FA reconciliation file format

title: Receiving external data
body: Files in supported formats are read as is. For other formats, you need to create a mapping and build a file integration with FA. For details, see Set up data sources.

title: Set up data sources
body: Reconciliation data is uploaded in FA Operations in a file (see Receiving external data. You can have multiple data sources for reconciliation, for example, if you reconcile positions and cash accounts, or if you receive position information from different custodians.

title: Set up data sources
body: To make external data available in FA Operations, you need to complete the following steps:

title: Fetch reconciliation file in FA
body: To fetch reconciliation data to FA system, you have the following options, depending on the custodian and the data they provide:

title: Fetch reconciliation file in FA
body: Use FA standard integrations. Currently, only DNB Bank and custody connection works with FA Operations out of the box. For details, see Bank and custody connections.

title: Fetch reconciliation file in FA
body: Upload the file yourself. To do this, you need to consider the following:

title: Fetch reconciliation file in FA
body: File format. If the files you receive from your counterparty are in one of the supported formats (see Receiving external data), FA system reads them as is. If the file format is unsupported, you need to create a mapping.

title: Fetch reconciliation file in FA
body: File upload. To import the data in FA, you need to upload it in the respective FA folder manually or build a Camel route that fetches the file automatically.

title: Fetch reconciliation file in FA
body: For details about file mapping and file upload, see Import custom CSV files to FA.

title: Fetch reconciliation file in FA
body: If you already use the reconciliation feature in FA Back, you can use your existing integration, provided that the integration delivers the files to one of the standard file locations {{back.writable.dir}}/reconciliation/standard/ or {{back.writable.dir}}/reconciliation/settlementDate/.

title: Set up the data source in FA Operations
body: To set up the data source:

title: Set up the data source in FA Operations
body: Open the Data sources view in FA Operations and click Add data source.

title: Set up the data source in FA Operations
body: Fill in the fields and define the data fetching options:

title: Set up the data source in FA Operations
body: Data source name

title: Set up the data source in FA Operations
body: The name of the data source. The data source name is visible in the Reconciliation overview.

title: Set up the data source in FA Operations
body: Data source code

title: Set up the data source in FA Operations
body: The code used to identify the data source. The data source code must match the name of the FA folder where the reconciliation file is uploaded. For example, if your reconciliation folder is .../nordea, the code must be "nordea". If you want to switch from carrying out reconciliation in FA Back from FA Operations, enter "default" as the data source code.

title: Set up the data source in FA Operations
body: Match portfolios by

title: Set up the data source in FA Operations
body: The portfolio property used to match portfolios from FA with the external data source. Choose one of the options: Short name, External ID, Name, Book entry.

title: Set up the data source in FA Operations
body: Match securities by

title: Set up the data source in FA Operations
body: The security property used to match securities from FA with the external data source. Choose one of the options depending on the identifiers you use: ISIN code, Security code, Trade code, Update code 1-3, Name.

title: Set up the data source in FA Operations
body: Data delivery schedule

title: Set up the data source in FA Operations
body: The schedule for fetching the external data to FA Operations. Define the frequency, date and time or enter the Cron expression in the advanced mode.

title: Set up the data source in FA Operations
body: Use settled balances

title: Set up the data source in FA Operations
body: Compare only settled account balances.

title: Set up the data source in FA Operations
body: Include subportfolios

title: Set up the data source in FA Operations
body: Include positions and cash accounts from subportfolios in the reconciliation.

title: Set up the data source in FA Operations
body: Reconcile items not in the source data

title: Set up the data source in FA Operations
body: Identify mismatches if FA positions are missing in the external reconciliation file. If you receive position information from different custodians, turn off this setting to skip the positions missing in the custodian's file.

title: Set up the data source in FA Operations
body: Date adjustment for data delivery

title: Set up the data source in FA Operations
body: The delay in receiving the reconciliation data. For example, if the reconciliation file received today contains the data for the previous day, set the date adjustment as "1". If the file is received on the same day , set the date adjustment as "0".

title: Set up the data source in FA Operations
body: Time zone

title: Set up the data source in FA Operations
body: Time zone used in the data delivery schedule.

title: Set up the data source in FA Operations
body: Click Save.

title: Set up the data source in FA Operations
body: After you set up the data source, it is shown in the Reconciliation overview, Upcoming reconciliations. You can view the reconciliation items when FA Operations receives external data.

title: View reconciliations
body: You can view reconciled positions and cash accounts in the Overview:

title: View reconciliations
body: Assigned to me – The summary of reconciliation items assigned to you.

title: View reconciliations
body: Open reconciliations – The list of open reconciliations and summary of all reconciliation items.

title: View reconciliations
body: Upcoming reconciliations – Upcoming reconciliation data that will be received by the system according to the schedule.

title: View reconciliations
body: <screenshot>

title: Open reconciliations and view items
body: To open the list of all items in the Open reconciliations section, click View items. To open the list of items in a certain reconciliation, click Open reconciliation. You can use the columns for sorting the rows. For the column descriptions, see Reconciliation item details.

title: Open reconciliations and view items
body: To view a reconciliation item, click . For the field descriptions, see Reconciliation item details.

title: Reconciliation item details
body: Reconciliation item properties are listed below:

title: Reconciliation item details
body: Type

title: Reconciliation item details
body: The type of the reconciliation item: position or cash account.

title: Reconciliation item details
body: Status

title: Reconciliation item details
body: The reconciliation result:

title: Reconciliation item details
body: Match – The data in the source and in the system are the same.

title: Reconciliation item details
body: Mismatch – The data in the source differs from the data in the system: the item is missing in the source or in the system or one of the amounts doesn't match.

title: Reconciliation item details
body: Fixed – The reconciliation item was fixed by correcting the system value or marked as solved.

title: Reconciliation item details
body: Not processed – The item reconciliation is in progress.

title: Reconciliation item details
body: Portfolio

title: Reconciliation item details
body: The portfolio containing the position or cash account. If a cash account is used in multiple portfolios, the Portfolio field is empty. The amounts from all portfolios are summed up.

title: Reconciliation item details
body: The list of reconciliation items shows the portfolio ID that is used to match portfolios between the system and the external source (see Set up data sources).

title: Reconciliation item details
body: The item details show the full portfolio information: portfolio short name, portfolio ID, name, short name, external ID, and book entry. To open the portfolio in FA Back, click .

title: Reconciliation item details
body: Security

title: Reconciliation item details
body: The security of the portfolio position.

title: Reconciliation item details
body: The list of reconciliation items shows the security ID that is used to match securities between the system and the external source (see Set up data sources).

title: Reconciliation item details
body: The item details show the full security information: security code, ISIN code, security name, trade code, and update codes.

title: Reconciliation item details
body: Account

title: Reconciliation item details
body: Cash account number.

title: Reconciliation item details
body: Assignee

title: Reconciliation item details
body: The assignee of the mismatch.

title: Reconciliation item details
body: System value

title: Reconciliation item details
body: Position amount or account balance in the system.

title: Reconciliation item details
body: Source value

title: Reconciliation item details
body: Position amount or account balance in the external source.

title: Reconciliation item details
body: Difference

title: Reconciliation item details
body: The difference between the source and system value (amount).

title: Reconciliation item details
body: Difference (%)

title: Reconciliation item details
body: The difference between the source and system in percent.

title: Reconciliation item details
body: Comment

title: Reconciliation item details
body: Comment on the mismatch.

title: Assign mismatches
body: You can assign a reconciliation or a certain mismatch to a user.

title: Assign a reconciliation
body: To assign a reconciliation to a user:

title: Assign a reconciliation
body: Open the reconciliation (click Open reconciliation in the Overview).

title: Assign a reconciliation
body: Click Edit details and fill in the fields:

title: Assign a reconciliation
body: Assignee

title: Assign a reconciliation
body: The user to assign reconciliation to.

title: Assign a reconciliation
body: Comment

title: Assign a reconciliation
body: A reconciliation note. Add a comment if needed.

title: Assign a reconciliation
body: Click Save.

title: Assign a reconciliation
body: The user can find the assigned reconciliations in the Overview, Assigned to me section.

title: Assign a mismatch
body: Assign a mismatch

title: Assign a mismatch
body: To assign a mismatch to a user for further investigation:

title: Assign a mismatch
body: Open the mismatch (click View item).

title: Assign a mismatch
body: Choose the user in the Assignee field and add a comment if needed

title: Assign a mismatch
body: Save the changes.

title: Assign a mismatch
body: The user can find the assigned items in the Overview, Assigned to me section.

title: Fix a mismatch
body: You can fix a mismatch in one of the ways:

title: Fix a mismatch
body: Correct the system value. Correct the data stored in FA so that it matches external data.

title: Fix a mismatch
body: Have a mismatch corrected by your counterparty.

title: Fix a mismatch
body: Mark a mismatch as solved in case this is a known issue that you don't need to fix.

title: Fix a mismatch
body: When all mismatches are resolved, the reconciliation is closed automatically. You can view closed reconciliations in the reconciliation history (see View reconciliation history).

title: View mismatch details
body: To view the mismatch details, open it by clicking View item in the reconciliation list. You can see the following information:

title: View mismatch details
body: Mismatch

title: View mismatch details
body: The value that doesn't match: Amount, Purchase trade amount, Market trade amount.

title: View mismatch details
body: System value

title: View mismatch details
body: The value stored in the FA system.

title: View mismatch details
body: Source value

title: View mismatch details
body: The value received from the external data source.

title: View mismatch details
body: Difference %

title: View mismatch details
body: The difference between the system value and the source value in percent.

title: Correct the system value
body: To correct the value stored in the FA system:

title: Correct the system value
body: Open FA Back and find the portfolio position or cash account.

title: Correct the system value
body: Correct the values in the position or cash account transactions.

title: Correct the system value
body: Open FA Operations and rerun reconciliation:

title: Correct the system value
body: For the item (click in the item details).

title: Correct the system value
body: For the whole data source (open the reconciliation and click Rerun reconciliation).

title: Correct the system value
body: After you fix the system value and rerun the reconciliation, the item status is updated to "Fixed".

title: Have a mismatch corrected by your counterparty
body: After a mismatch is corrected by your counterparty, make sure the data is updated in FA Operations:

title: Have a mismatch corrected by your counterparty
body: Close the current reconciliation with incorrect data. See Close reconciliation.

title: Have a mismatch corrected by your counterparty
body: Upload the corrected data in FA Operations:

title: Have a mismatch corrected by your counterparty
body: If your system is set up to receive external data automatically, the corrected values will be available in the next reconciliation according to the schedule.

title: Have a mismatch corrected by your counterparty
body: If you upload the reconciliation file yourself, you need to obtain the file with the corrected values and upload it to the system. The corrected values will be available after upload is complete.

title: Mark a mismatch as solved
body: In case the mismatch is a known issue, you can mark it as solved:

title: Mark a mismatch as solved
body: Open the mismatch (click View item).

title: Mark a mismatch as solved
body: Click Mark as solved and save the changes.

title: Mark a mismatch as solved
body: After you mark a mismatch as solved, the item status changes to "Fixed".

title: Close reconciliation
body: A reconciliation closes automatically when all mismatches are resolved. You can close a reconciliation yourself if you don't need to work on it anymore – for example, if you receive new data or if you want to leave multiple known mismatches without fixing them. To close a reconciliation:

title: Close reconciliation
body: Open the reconciliation (click Open reconciliation in the Overview).

title: Close reconciliation
body: Click Edit details and fill in the fields:

title: Close reconciliation
body: Status

title: Close reconciliation
body: Reconciliation status. Select "Closed".

title: Close reconciliation
body: Comment

title: Close reconciliation
body: A reconciliation note. Add a comment if needed.

title: Close reconciliation
body: Click Save.

title: Close reconciliation
body: You can view closed reconciliations in the reconciliation history (see View reconciliation history).

title: View reconciliation history
body: To access open and closed reconciliations, open the History view. You can see who and when made changes in reconciliation items, and download the reconciliation summary.

title: View reconciliation history
body: <screenshot>

title: View reconciliations
body: The Reconciliations tab of the History view shows the list of all reconciliations in the system. You can:

title: View reconciliations
body: Download the reconciliations list in the CSV, XLSX format or print the page as PDF (click Export).

title: View reconciliations
body: View reconciliation details and the list of reconciled items (click Details in the reconciliation row). To download the reconciliation report, then click Download report in the upper-right corner. If the reconciliation is open, you can make changes or rerun the reconciliation.

title: View reconciliations
body: View the details and the audit log of each reconciliation item (click in the item row). To download the reconciliation report, click the PDF icon . If the item is open, you can make changes or rerun the reconciliation for it.

title: View all reconciliation items
body: The Reconciliation items tab of the History view shows the list of all reconciliation items that have been uploaded in the system. You can:

title: View all reconciliation items
body: Download the list of all items in the CSV, XLSX format or print the page as PDF (click Export).

title: View all reconciliation items
body: View the details and the audit log of each reconciliation item (click in the item row). To download the reconciliation report, click the PDF icon . If the item is open, you can make changes or rerun the reconciliation for it.

title: Download reconciliation reports
body: You can download PDF reports for the whole reconciliation or for a chosen reconciliation item.

title: Reconciliation report
body: Reconciliation report

title: Reconciliation report
body: The reconciliation report in the PDF format contains the following sections:

title: Reconciliation report
body: Summary: the reconciliation information (ID, date, assignee, comment) and item statistics.

title: Reconciliation report
body: Positions: the list of positions with the item details.

title: Reconciliation report
body: Cash accounts: the list of cash accounts with the item details.

title: Reconciliation report
body: Audit trail: the list of changes in the reconciliation items.

title: Reconciliation report
body: To download the reconciliation report, open the reconciliation and click Generate report .

title: Reconciliation item report
body: The reconciliation item report in the PDF format contains the following sections:

title: Reconciliation item report
body: Summary: position or cash account information (ID, status, portfolio and security IDs, assignee and comment).

title: Reconciliation item report
body: Comparison: reconciliation of amounts in FA and in the external source.

title: Reconciliation item report
body: Audit trail: the list of changes in the reconciliation item.

title: Reconciliation item report
body: To download the reconciliation item report, open the reconciliation item and click Download as PDF .

title: Investment service costs
body: One-off charges related to the provision of an investment service All costs and charges paid to the investment firm at the beginning or at the end of the provided investment service(s). Deposit fees, termination fees, switching costs (costs that can be incurred by investors by switching from one investment firm to another investment firm)

title: Investment service costs
body: On-going charges related to the provision of an investment service All on-going costs and charges paid to investment firms for their services provided to the client Management fees, advisory fees, custodian fees.

title: Investment service costs
body: All costs related to transactions initiated in the course of the provision of an investment service All costs and charges that are related to transactions performed by the investment firm or other parties. Broker commissions (costs that are charged by investment firms for the execution of orders), entry and exit charges paid to the fund manager, platform fees, markups (embedded in the transaction price), stamp duty, transactions tax foreign exchange costs

title: Investment service costs
body: Any charges that are related to ancillary services Any costs and charges related to ancillary services not included in the costs mentioned above. Research costs, custody costs

title: Investment service costs
body: Incidental costs Performance fees

title: Investment product costs
body: One-off charges All costs and charges (included in the price or in addition to the price of the financial instrument) paid to product suppliers at the beginning or at the end of the investment in the financial instrument. Front-loaded management fee, structuring fee (fees charged by manufacturers of structured investment products for structuring the products which may cover a broader range of services provided by the manufacturer), distribution fee

title: Investment product costs
body: On-going charges All on-going costs and charges related to the management of the financial product that are deducted from the value of the financial instrument during the investment in the financial instrument. Management fees, service costs, swap fees, security lending costs and taxes, financing costs.

title: Investment product costs
body: All costs related to transactions All costs and charges that incurred as a result of the acquisition and disposal of investments. Broker commissions, entry and exit charges paid by the fund, markups embedded in the transaction price, stamp duty, transactions tax, foreign exchange costs

title: Investment product costs
body: Incidental costs Performance fees

title: Figures in Analytics+ view
body: Column Description

title: Figures in Analytics+ view
body: %-figures for charges (top table) Fee in question / (Average portfolio market value during given time period + total ex-post costs) We compare to a gross portfolio value rather than a net value because comparing to a net value produces misleading results in extreme cases.

title: Figures in Analytics+ view
body: Gross and net return (bottom table) Gross and net TWR. Note that this usually does not exactly match the percentages in the top table because TWR is not the same as a simple return!

title: Figures in Analytics+ view
body: Other costs (currency) The sum of other costs 1-5

title: Figures in Analytics+ view
body: Other costs (percent) The sum of other costs 1-5 / (Average portfolio market value during a given time period + total costs) = Other costs percentage of gross portfolio value.

title: Figures in Analytics+ view
body: Total costs and charges -columns The sum of the corresponding Investment services and Financial Instruments columns. We sum these up in the report instead of directly using the total field provided by Analytics+ because it would also include third-party payments of that category. Third-party payments are reported in a separate row instead of a new column.

title: Available columns for positions listings
body: Name (ENG) Name (FI) Name (SWE) Description

title: Available columns for positions listings
body: Amount Amount (p) Amount (p, o) Amount (p, t) Kpl Kpl (p) Kpl (p, o) Kpl (p, t) Antal Antal (p) Antal (p, o) Antal (p, t) Shows the amount of the security in the portfolio based on the transaction date (amount), when all Executable trade orders would have been executed (p, o), when all accepted non-settled (i.e. settlement date later than today or no settlement date at all) transactions would have been settled (p, t) or when all Executable trade orders and accepted non-settled transactions would have been executed and settled (p). For accounts and cash balance, the amount shows the account balance based on transaction date, amount (p, o) the cash balance after Executable trade orders that deduct cash have been executed, amount (p, t) the currently settled cash balance (excluding non-settled transactions, i.e. transactions that have a settlement date in the future), and amount (p) the combination of the two above.

title: Available columns for positions listings
body: Accr. int. Accr. int (c) Kert. korot Kert. korot (v) Upplupen ränta Upplupen räntä (v) Shows the accrued interest for your position in portfolio currency or in security currency (c), when fixing information is defined in security's Extra information. For a new position, the accrued interest is the accrued interest bought within the buy transaction until the settlement date of the buy, after which the accrued interest is calculated with the defined coupon information. Also shows the accrued interest for accounts. For accounts, the accrued interest is calculated day-by-day and is shown as a total amount.

title: Available columns for positions listings
body: Accrual Accrual (c) Kertymä Kertymä (v) Upplupen Upplupen (v) Error parsing MathML: error on line 1 at column 173: Namespace prefix xinfo for text on mi is not defined

title: Available columns for positions listings
body: Change Change (o) Change % Change % (o) Muutos Muutos (a) Muutos-% Muutos-% (a) Förändring Förändring (o) Förändring % Förändring % (o) Shows the difference between the Purchase value and Market value columns: how much the purchase value has changed. Also available as the change between the purchase price and market price columns with the original purchase price (o), in percentage (%) or in percentage with the original purchase price (% (o)).

title: Available columns for positions listings
body: Total commitment Total commitment (c) Remaining commitment Remaining commitment (c) Jäljellä oleva sitoumus Jäljellä oleva sitoumus (v) Kokonaissitoumus Kokonaissitoumus (v) Återstående åtagande Återstående åtagande (v) Total åtagande Total åtagande (v) Shows the total commitment of the position, based on transaction types that increase commitment in portfolio currency or in security currency (c), or the remaining commitment of the position, based on transaction types that either increase or reduce commitment in portfolio currency or in security currency (c). Commitments are relevant for example for private equity investments.

title: Available columns for positions listings
body: Currency (Price) Currency Valuutta (hinta) Valuutta Valuta (pris) Valuta Shows the currency defined for the security or currency exposure. The latter column shows the currency the instrument is exposed to: if the security has an underlay, and the underlay is a currency, the code of the underlying security is shown, otherwise the currency of the underlying security is shown. If the security doesn't have an underlay, and if the security is a currency, the code of the security is shown, otherwise the currency of the security is shown.

title: Available columns for positions listings
body: Days Pv Dagar Shows the position's age in the portfolio, calculated from the the date of the oldest open purchase lot.

title: Available columns for positions listings
body: Exposure Exposure Exposure Error parsing MathML: error on line 1 at column 173: Namespace prefix xinfo for text on mi is not defined

title: Available columns for positions listings
body: Holding % Omistus % Innehav % Shows the share of position’s amount out of the total outstanding amount defined in the security, indicating how large of a share does the portfolio hold of the security.

title: Available columns for positions listings
body: MPrice MPrice (c) Mh/kpl Mh/kpl (v) MPris MPris (v) Shows the current market unit price of the security in the portfolio currency or market price in currency (c). The date in parentheses tells the date of the market unit price: if there is no date after the market unit price, the price observation is dated for the viewing date (chosen above the portfolio contents). If no market price is defined for a security, this columns shows a line.

title: Available columns for positions listings
body: MPrice daily change Mh Pv. muutos MPris daglig förändring Shows the percentage change between the selected date's market price compared to the previous market price found.

title: Available columns for positions listings
body: Market date M. pvm Marknadsdatum Shows the date of the market price utilized as the market unit price and in calculating the market value, if the utilized market price is not the selected day's price.

title: Available columns for positions listings
body: Market val. Markkinahinta Marknadspris Shows the total market price of the security or the account balance in the portfolio currency, based on the latest market price or the exchange rate of the account currency. If no market price is defined for a security, the market price is calculated with the unit purchase price. Market value on the Overview excludes accrual on your fund positions (from FA 3.8 onward) and accrued interests on your bond positions.

title: Available columns for positions listings
body: Market value (d) Markkinahinta (d) Marknadspris (d) Shows the "dirty" market value, or a proper market value for your bonds and futures: this column shows a sum of market value + accrued interest for your bond positions, the P/L for your future positions, sum of market value + accrual for your fund positions (from FA 3.8 onward), and market value for all other types of instruments. (Available from FA 3.7 onward)

title: Available columns for positions listings
body: Market FX rate Markkina-valuuttakurssi Marknads-valutakurs Shows the exchange rate used to calculate the market value of the position in portfolio currency.

title: Available columns for positions listings
body: Orders Orders (all) Toimarit Toimarit (kaikki) Beställningar Beställningar (alla) Shows the effect the executable trade orders (orders) or executable and open trade orders (all) will have on the position's amount when executed. E.g. an executable sell trade order in the portfolio with the amount 100 will show as -100 in the columns.

title: Available columns for positions listings
body: PP / unit PP/u (c) PP/u (o) PP/u (oc) PP/u (desc.) Hh/kpl Hh/kpl (v) Hh/kpl (a) Hh/kpl (av) Hh/kpl (des.) PP/styck PP/styck (v) PP/styck (o) PP/styck (ov) PP/styck (desc.) Shows the purchase unit price of the security in the portfolio currency: the unit price the security was purchased with. Also available purchase unit price in currency (c), with the original price (o), with the original price in currency (oc) or with all available decimals (desc.). For accounts, the purchase unit price tells the exchange rate of currency of the account against the portfolio currency.

title: Available columns for positions listings
body: PPc/u PPc/u (c) Hhk/kpl Hhk/kpl (v) PPc/styck PPc/styck (v) Shows the purchase unit price without cost or purchase unit price without cost in currency (c).

title: Available columns for positions listings
body: Purchase value Hankintahinta Inköpsvärde Shows the total purchase value of the security or the account balance in the portfolio currency. Purchase value on the Overview excludes paid accrual on your fund positions (from FA 3.8 onward) and paid accrued interests on your bond positions.

title: Available columns for positions listings
body: Purchase value without cost Hankintahinta ilman kuluja Inköpsvärde utan kostnad Shows the total purchase value of the security or the account balance in the portfolio currency without costs.

title: Available columns for positions listings
body: Purch. val (o) Hankintahinta (a) Inköpsbelopp (o)Sh Shows the purchase value calculated with original price.

title: Available columns for positions listings
body: Security Arvopaperi Värdepapper This column divides the contents of the portfolio into securities and accounts. The securities are divided under subtitles based on the security types configured in the system, and the accounts section shows all the accounts added to the portfolio. The total of the securities and accounts are calculated, and you can find them on the rows Securities total and Accounts total . There are also a Portfolio total calculations available.

title: Available columns for positions listings
body: Share % Osuus % Andel % Shows percentage share of the position's market value from portfolio's total market value.

title: FA Format for importing account thresholds
body: Field Description Example value

title: FA Format for importing account thresholds
body: ait.shortName The ID of the portfolio in which the threshold is imported. 72008140735

title: FA Format for importing account thresholds
body: ait.accountNumber The account number of the account in which the threshold is imported. FI4950009420028730

title: FA Format for importing account thresholds
body: ait.date Date from which the threshold is valid in yyyy-MM-dd format. 2023-09-25

title: FA Format for importing account thresholds
body: ait.from Minimum balance for the threshold (inclusive); a decimal number with a dot as the decimal separator. 0.5

title: FA Format for importing account thresholds
body: ait.to Maximum balance for the threshold (exclusive); a decimal number with a dot as the decimal separator. 1000.5

title: FA Format for importing account thresholds
body: ait.spread Spread; a decimal number with a dot as the decimal separator. 0.5

title: FA Format for importing portfolios
body: # Code Required Name Description

title: FA Format for importing portfolios
body: 1 p.shortName Yes Portfolio ID Text or number uniquely identifying a portfolio. When creating a new portfolio, define AUTO to automatically use the next available number as the portfolio ID, if the "Generate a running number for portfolio ID automatically" is enabled in Portfolios Preferences.

title: FA Format for importing portfolios
body: 2 p.name Yes Name Portfolio name

title: FA Format for importing portfolios
body: 3 p.creationDate No Creation date yyyy-MM-dd. Date when the portfolio was created.

title: FA Format for importing portfolios
body: 4 p.extId No External ID External contract ID such as book-entry account number

title: FA Format for importing portfolios
body: 5 p.status Yes Status Use the code of the status: A = Active P = Passive C = Closed

title: FA Format for importing portfolios
body: 6 p.type Yes Type Type code (configured in the system)

title: FA Format for importing portfolios
body: 7 Match type Not used.

title: FA Format for importing portfolios
body: 8 p.currency Yes Reporting currency Reporting currency code.

title: FA Format for importing portfolios
body: 9 p.description No Description Open text field

title: FA Format for importing portfolios
body: 10 p.info1 No Info 1 Open text field

title: FA Format for importing portfolios
body: 11 p.info2 No Info 2 Open text field

title: FA Format for importing portfolios
body: 12 p.info3 No Info 3 Open text field

title: FA Format for importing portfolios
body: 13 p.notes No Notes Text, notes or memo on the portfolio.

title: FA Format for importing portfolios
body: 14 p.valuationMethod No Valuation method Use the code of the valuation methods: FIFO (default)FIFOP = FIFO (combined)AVER = Average priceAVER2 = Average price with adjustmentsAVER3 = Average price with separate items.

title: FA Format for importing portfolios
body: 15 p.language Yes Language Language code (configured in the system)

title: FA Format for importing portfolios
body: 16 p.primaryContact No Primary contact Primary contact (contact ID). To import representative tag values, add them after ###: Standalone tags are added as <contact ID>###<tag name>. For example: 04012000##parent.Single-select group tags are added as <contact ID>###<group name>-<tag name>. For example: 04012000##relative-parent.Multi-select group tags are added as a comma-separated list of values: <contact ID>###<group name>:<tag name 1>,<group name>:<tag name 2>. For example: 04012000###Employee:Finance,Employee:Accounting.

title: FA Format for importing portfolios
body: 17 p.contact No Other contacts Portfolio's other contacts. Contact IDs as a comma-separated list. To import representative tag values, add them after ###. Standalone tags are added as <contact ID>###<tag name>. For example: 04012000##parent.Single-select group tags are added as <contact ID>###<group name>-<tag name>. For example: 04012000##relative-parent.Multi-select group tags are added as a comma-separated list of values: <contact ID>###<group name>:<tag name 1>,<group name>:<tag name 2>. For example: 04012000###Employee:Finance,Employee:Accounting.

title: FA Format for importing portfolios
body: 18 Default account Not used.

title: FA Format for importing portfolios
body: 19 p.accounts No Accounts  A colon-separated (:) list of the portfolio accounts. To add accounts to a portfolio, use the following syntax: <Account no.>,<Currency with currency code>,<Name>,<Visibility as 0=not visible 1=visible>,<Shared as 0=not shared 1=shared>,<Priority as integer>;<BIC code>,<Mandate>,<Secondary account number>,<Category>,<Account type as 0=not cash, 1=cash, 2=credit>,<Hide if zero as 0=don’t hide, 1=hide>,<Tags separated with #>,<Issuer with contact ID>,<Calendar with the calendar code>,<Fixing as a number>,<Base instrument with the security code>,<Spread as a number>,<Exclude balance as 0=don't exclude, 1=exclude>,<Shared with all as 0=not shared, 1=shared>, <Shared to all parent portfolio's subportfolios as 0=not shared, 1=shared>, <Decimals for transactions as a number>, <Transaction type code>, <Offset days as an integer>. For example, a list of two accounts: FI12 3456 78,EUR,Euro account,1,0,1,NDEAFIHHXXX,12345678,12345-678,Bank account,1,0,Client account#Status OK:234-321,USD,Dollar account,0,1,2,,,,,1,0,Client account#Status OK,,Act/360,0.2,LIBOR,1.5,0,0,0,4 The account currency (second in the syntax) is validated to be a valid currency in the system. Supported calendar codes: 1/130/360ISDA30/360 PSA30E+/36030E/36030E/360 ISDA30U/36030U/36030U/360 EOMAct/360Act/364Act/365 ActualAct/365.25Act/365FAct/365LAct/366Act/366.375Act/Act AFBAct/Act ICMAAct/Act ISDAAct/Act YearNL/365 You can use *** syntax to add new accounts for the portfolio while keeping the old ones, but this is not required. Without ***, old values are still preserved. For example: ***:<Account>:<Account>). For details, see Updating contacts and portfolios. To update the account number of an existing account, use the syntax "[old account no]new account no" in the first field of the account syntax. For example, if you want to update an account number from 1000 to 1010, define the account number in the syntax as [1000]1010. To keep the accounts unchanged, import an empty value in the field. Existing accounts cannot be removed using import.

title: FA Format for importing portfolios
body: 20 p.assetManagers No Asset managers Portfolio's asset managers. Contact IDs as a comma-separated list. To import representative tag values, add them after ###. Standalone tags are added as <contact ID>###<tag name>. For example: 04012000##parent.Single-select group tags are added as <contact ID>###<group name>-<tag name>. For example: 04012000##relative-parent.Multi-select group tags are added as a comma-separated list of values: <contact ID>###<group name>:<tag name 1>,<group name>:<tag name 2>. For example: 04012000###Employee:Finance,Employee:Accounting.

title: FA Format for importing portfolios
body: 21 p.fees No Fees List of portfolio fees: <type>=<fee percent>. Types are: transaction, payment, withdrawal, management. E.g. transaction=2.3, management=1.5 You can use *** syntax to add fees to the portfolio and keep the existing ones. For example: ***,payment=3,withdrawal=3.9. For details, see Updating contacts and portfolios.

title: FA Format for importing portfolios
body: 22 p.startDate No Start date yyyy-MM-dd, portfolio start date

title: FA Format for importing portfolios
body: 23 p.updateDate No Update date yyyy-MM-dd, portfolio update

title: FA Format for importing portfolios
body: 24 p.ruleSet No Posting rule Code of the posting rule set. For multiple posting rule sets, use comma-separated list of posting rule set codes (available from FA 3.12 onward).

title: FA Format for importing portfolios
body: 25 p.extPortfolioIdList No External IDs List of portfolio's external ID's. Use the following syntax <ext_id1=ext_name1>,<ext_id2=ext_name2> etc. If ext_id and ext_name combination for the same portfolio exist just use the existing one, otherwise create new one. If ext_id and ext_name combination exist but for a different portfolio, will show error message.

title: FA Format for importing portfolios
body: 26 p.benchmark No Benchmark Benchmark code (configured in the system) or in order to use portfolio specific benchmarks, use the following syntax <yyyy-MM-dd>,<security1 code>=<share1>,<security code2>=<share2>:<yyyy-MM-dd>,<security code3>=<share3> etc. You can use *** syntax to add new entries to the existing benchmark and keep the existing ones. For details, see Updating contacts and portfolios.

title: FA Format for importing portfolios
body: 27 p.country No Country Country code (configured in the system), if not given will use primary contact's tax country

title: FA Format for importing portfolios
body: 28 p.juridical No Juridical Juridical form code (configured in the system), if not given will use primary contact's juridical form

title: FA Format for importing portfolios
body: 29 p.emailAddresses No Email addresses Comma-separated list of email addresses. E.g. a@fasolutions.com, b@fasolutions.com

title: FA Format for importing portfolios
body: 30 p.reportContacts No Report contacts Comma-separated list of contact IDs

title: FA Format for importing portfolios
body: 31 p.closeMethod No Close method Define as a number: 0 = "Choose" 1 = "No change" 2 = "Depreciation" 3 = "Depreciation and refund" 4 = "Market value"

title: FA Format for importing portfolios
body: 32 p.portfolioGroups No Group Comma-separated list of groups (codes) that the portfolio belongs to. Groups and their codes are configured in the system. You can use *** syntax to add new groups to the portfolio and keep the existing ones. For example: ***,<group code>. For details, see Updating contacts and portfolios.

title: FA Format for importing portfolios
body: 33 p.custody No Custody Contact for the custody (use the Contact ID to identify the custody).

title: FA Format for importing portfolios
body: 34 p.bookEntry No Book entry String value for book entry account

title: FA Format for importing portfolios
body: 35 p.modelPortfolio No Model portfolio Name of the model portfolio (configured in the system)

title: FA Format for importing portfolios
body: 36 p.costFormulas No Cost formula Comma-separated list of cost formula codes (configured in the system)

title: FA Format for importing portfolios
body: 37 p.tags No Tags "The "Tags" field is a comma-separated list of tags that you can use to categorize your portfolios. To add a tag:  Standalone tags can be added by simply typing the tag name. For example, if you want to add a tag for a Fund and a tag for a ContractOK, you can add them like this: "Fund,ContractOK".Single-select group tags should be added in the format <group name>-<tag name>. For example, if you want to add a tag for an office location in Helsinki, you can add it like this: "office-Helsinki". If a portfolio already has a tag with the same group name, the new tag will replace the old one.Multi-select group tags should be added in the format <group name>:<tag name 1>,<group name>:<tag name 2>, etc. For example, if you want to add tags for stocks and bonds in your Investments group, you can add them like this: "Investments:Stocks,Investments:Bonds". If a portfolio already has tags with the same group name, the new tags will be added to the existing ones. To remove a tag, use the syntax "---" followed by the tag name or tag group name. For example:  To remove a standalone tag for "Fund", you can use "---Fund".To remove a single-select group tag for "office-Helsinki", you can use "---office-Helsinki".To remove multi-select group tags for "Investments:Stocks" and "Investments:Bonds", you can use "---Investments:Stocks,---Investments:Bonds". For details, see Removing contact and portfolio values with three minuses (---).

title: FA Format for importing portfolios
body: 38 p.priceSource No Price source The method to determine the close market price for the securities in the portfolio. To use the prices from Security's Market data info tab, leave the field empty. To use the first available price from the price fields in the Security's Market data info tab (checking the column values in the order specified above), specify Default. To define a different priority of price source fields, enter a comma-separated list of columns in the order of priority. The values are: Manual, Close 1, Close 2, Close 3, Close 4, Close 5. You can use *** syntax to add new values in the list of price source fields and keep the existing ones. For details, see Updating contacts and portfolios. You can use three minuses (for example, ---Close 1) to remove a value.

title: FA Format for importing portfolios
body: 39 p.investmentPlan No Investment plan Portfolio-specific investment plan, use the following syntax <yyyy-MM-dd>,<security 1 code>=<share 1>,<security 2 code>=<share 2>:<yyyy-MM-dd>,<security 3 code>=<share 3> etc. If you want to import an investment plan with minimum and maximum shares, use the following syntax <yyyy-MM-dd>,<securityCode1>=<share1#minShare1#maxShare1>,<securityCode2>=<share2#minShare2#maxShare2>;<yyyy-MM-dd>;,<securityCode3>=<share3#minShare3#maxShare3> etc. Min and max shares are validated to align in relation to the target share (i.e. min smaller / max higher or equal to the target). (Available from FA 3.8 onward) You can use *** syntax to add new entries to the investment plan and keep the existing ones. For example: ***:2019-01-01,NOKIA=25#20#30,AMAZON=15#10#20. For details, see Updating contacts and portfolios.

title: FA Format for importing portfolios
body: 40 p.profileAttributes No Profile Portfolio-specific profile (configured in the system). Use the following syntax to import / update profile information: <key>=<value>:<type>#<key>=<value>:<type> etc. Note that importing checkbox fields requires you to use the type "boolean" and importing date fields requires you to use the type "date" in the syntax. Profile import allows you to add or modify profile values with a specific key - existing profile values are not replaced / removed unless you specifically include their key within the import syntax. To remove an attribute value, use the syntax described in Updating contacts and portfolios. For example: :---<key>. You can use three minuses (---) syntax to remove an attribute value. For example: ---<key>. For details, see Removing contact and portfolio values with three minuses (---).

title: FA Format for importing portfolios
body: 41 p.strategy No Strategy Portfolio specific strategy, use the following syntax <yyyy-MM-dd>,<assetTypeCode1#assetGroupCode1>=<share1#minShare1#maxShare1#FIXED>,<assetTypeCode2#assetGroupCode2>=<share2#minShare2#maxShare2>:<yyyy-MM-dd>,<assetTypeCode3#asset & GroupCode3>=<share3#minShare3#maxShare3> etc. For interpolation, specify "INTERPOLATION", calendar code, and two dates before the asset types. For example: INTERPOLATION=SatSun:<yyyy-MM-dd>,<assetTypeCode1#assetGroupCode1>=<share1#minShare1#maxShare1>,<assetTypeCode2#assetGroupCode2>=<share2#minShare2#maxShare2>, etc. For an asset type that is excluded from strategy analysis, specify "EXCLUDED" followed by three dots: <yyyy-MM-dd>,<assetTypeCode1#assetGroupCode1>=EXCLUDED... You can use *** syntax to add new entries to the strategy and keep the existing ones, for example: ***:2019-01-01,ASSET#MOD=100#0#100. For details, see Updating contacts and portfolios.

title: FA Format for importing portfolios
body: 42 p.parent No Parent portfolio Comma-separated list of parent portfolios' Portfolio IDs. The imported portfolio will be marked as the sub-portfolio to all the defined parent / main portfolios. You can use *** syntax to add new parent portfolios and keep the existing ones. For details, see Updating contacts and portfolios.

title: FA Format for importing portfolios
body: 43 p.accruedInterestValuation No Accrued interest Define as a number: 0 = "Transaction date" 1 = "Settlement date" If no value is filled in, the default value 0 "Transaction date" is used. (Available from FA 3.1 onward)

title: FA Format for importing portfolios
body: 44 p.keyFigures No Key figures Define the key figure code and individual observations as date-value pairs as a comma-separated list with the format <code>=<date:yyyy-MM-dd>=<value>,<date:yyyy-MM-dd>=<value>:<code>=<date:yyyy-MM-dd>=<value>,... For example, AAA=2009-01-01=1.9,2010-01-01=1.10:TAX=2007-01-01=1,2010-01-01=2 You can use *** syntax to add new observations to the list and keep the existing ones. For details, see Updating contacts and portfolios. (Available from FA 3.4 onward)

title: FA Format for importing portfolios
body: 45 p.aggregatingSubportfolios No Aggregation of subportfolios Define as a number: 0 = Sum up values1 = Recalculate values

title: FA Format for importing portfolios
body: 46 p.locked No Locked Define as a number: 0 = Not locked (default)1 = Locked

title: FA Format for importing contacts
body: 23 c.representatives No Representatives Comma-separated list of contact IDs representing the contact, for example, 1223,1224,1225. To import contact representative tag values, add them after ###: Standalone tags are added as <representative's contact ID>###<tag name>. For example: 04012000##parent.Single-select group tags are added as <representative's contact ID>###<group name>-<tag name>. For example: 04012000##relative-parent.Multi-select group tags are added as a comma-separated list of values: <representative's contact ID>###<group name>:<tag name 1>,<group name>:<tag name 2>. For example: 04012000###Employee:Finance,Employee:Accounting. You can use *** syntax to add new representatives and keep the existing ones. For example: ***,1223,1224. For details, see Updating contacts and portfolios. To add representatives to the contact that doesn't have any representatives, define "???," in the beginning of the column's content (e.g. ???,1223,1224). If the contact already had representatives, the existing representatives will be kept and the new ones won't be added.

title: FA Format for importing contacts
body: 24 c.language No Language Language code (configured in the system)

title: FA Format for importing contacts
body: 25 c.subType No Sub type Contact sub type code (configured in the system). When a sub type is given, it will find its own parent contact type and override the given contact type's code (in column 4).

Use the following syntax to import settlement place information: <settlement place code>=<counter>. E.g. APKEFIHH=ESSEFIHX,MGTCBEBE=ESSEFIHX

For example: Fund,ContractOK.Single-select group tags should be added as <group name>-<tag name>. For example: office-Helsinki. If a contact already has a tag with the same group name, the tag is replaced.Multi-select group tags should be added as a comma-separated list of values <group name>:<tag name 1>,<group name>:<tag name 2>. For example: Interests:Golf,Interests:Culture. If a contact already has tags with the same group name, the new tag is added to the existing ones. You can use three minuses (---) syntax to remove a tag: Standalone tags: ---<tag name>. For example: ---Fund,---ContractOK.Single-select group tags: ---<group name>-<tag name>. For example: —office-Helsinki.Multi-select group tags: ---<group name>:<tag name 1>,---<group name>:<tag name 2>. For example: ---Interests:Golf,---Interests:Culture. For details, see Removing contact and portfolio values with three minuses (---).

body: 31 c.profileAttributes No Profile Contact-specific profile (configured in the system). Use the following syntax to import / update profile information: <key>=<value>:<type>#<key>=<value>:<type> etc. Note that importing checkbox fields requires you to use the type "boolean" and importing date fields requires you to use the type "date" in the syntax. Profile import allows you to add or modify profile values with a specific key - existing profile values are not replaced or removed unless you specifically include their key within the import syntax. You can use three minuses (---) syntax to remove a profile attribute value. For example: ---<key>. For details, see Removing contact and portfolio values with three minuses (---).

title: FA Format for importing contacts
body: 32 c.extContactIdList No External IDs List of contact's external ID's. Use the following syntax <ext_id1=ext_name1>,<ext_id2=ext_name2> etc. If ext_id and ext_name combination for the same contact exist just use the existing one, otherwise create new one. If ext_id and ext_name combination exist but for a different contact, will show error message.

title: FA Format for importing contacts
body: 33 c.keyFigures No Key figures Define the key figure code and individual observations as date-value pairs as a comma-separated list with the format <code>=<date:yyyy-MM-dd>=<value&>&<date:yyyy-MM-dd>=<value>:<code>=<date:yyyy-MM-dd>=<value>,... E.g. AAA=2009-01-01=1.9,2010-01-01=1.10:TAX=2007-01-01=1,2010-01-01=2 When importing categorized key figures (e.g. 1=Low, 2=Medium, 3=High), prior to 3.7.7 you should use the "number" (e.g. 1, 2 or 3), and after 3.7.7 you should use the "text" (e.g. Low, Medium, High). You can use *** syntax to add new observations and keep the existing ones. For example: ***:BBB=2007-01-01=1,2010-01-01=3. For details, see Updating contacts and portfolios.
